--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> wrote:
> >So said Dave Astels on 2003-07-24 --------------------

> >Actually you don't need getters at all.  Mock the interface, and set
> >expectations on the set calls.  Then pass that into the
> >builder/parser.  You don't need to capture the args other than to
> >compare them with what was expected.
> 
> For some odd reason I don't like setting expectations on an object 
> then letting it verify itself. Sounds weird. I prefer to be the one to
> verify it. I don't know why.

Something to do with being in Toronto, no doubt.

Seriously.. that's interesting... your way means you have to write
more code.  I'd use EasyMock for the Mock to avoid having to make a
"real" mock class.

Dave
